text: Does anyone know if it's possible to use the post filter module to show only certain tags we select, rather than all of them? Our client wants to be able to change which tag topics are shown on the blog page on a regular basis.
You could always build a custom module that lets them pick tags. Just need a single repeater field, a loop, and the blog_tag_url function
Ah, that's what I was thinking Ian but wasn't too sure. Still getting to grips with HubSpot so appreciate the help. Thanks! :slightly_smiling_face:
To follow-up here, your CAMs can now spin-up trials of the CMS for existing customers. cc: <@U26C29XPH> <@U3VN3LMME>
So we have a client who is just so awesome at paying their HS Bill, how many months over the past due date does the client get before the portal is suspended from access?
is it 3mo?
That's been our experience
awesome, so i have 2 days to complete my work lol
thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

I also strongly suggest making a local static copy of the site just in case. Wget has saved me quite a few times, especially if there are flex columns or anything else that isn't explicitly set at the page or template levels, you'll probably lose things like that.
Wget?
<https://swsblog.stanford.edu/blog/creating-static-copy-website>
it's a command line tool that will download a whole site and you can configure it to follow links a certain way, convert assets to relative links, etc...
Yeah I just used wget yesterday. It is handy AF. Downloaded 100 pdfs in like 2 mins… On a mac I had to use homebrew to DL it btw…
Sitesucker works great also
The built-in site export also does this
native forms do not mean iframed forms, right? … the iframe is meant to be used on non-HubSpot hosted websites
<@U22PJPGK0> is the custom modules code included in those exports?
no code, only pages and files

hi folks, i am working on an rss email and HubSpot is auto inserting float: left on an image. which of course does not work in outlook 2016. any idea how to make the image float left when you have no control over the inline styles that HubSpot inserts?
Can you add `align="left"` to the image in addition to the float?
no, i cant add any inline styling, only css
swap with a html or hubl module
jon, can you do that with email templates?
yes pretty sure you can use html modules in the drag n drop email templates
do you know how to break up the "summary" rss token into its component parts?
I don't know how that interacts with the RSS emails, those are kind of their own weird thing
overall, i find it infuriating that HubSpot uses floats instead of align ... dont they know it doesnt work in outlook
